metadata.title: CVE-2019-13377 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: The implementations of SAE and EAP-pwd in hostapd and wpa_supplicant 2.xthrough 2.8 are vulnerable to side-channel attacks as a result ofobservable timing differences and cache access patterns when Brainpoolcurves are used. An attacker may be able to gain leaked information from aside-channel attack that can be used for full password recovery.

criterions.comment: wpa: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
